{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3493681,"name":"Chris","username":"Chris_7898","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_7898/{size}/226133_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T14:44:33.043Z","cooked":"

I am currently trying to setup a follower motor in our code but using the Motor.follow(Motor2) does not work. Is there a different way I need to be doing this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T14:44:33.043Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":122,"reads":87,"readers_count":86,"score":627.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483795,"topic_slug":"rev-robotics-follower-issue","display_username":"Chris","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60542,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5561 Prog Lead"},"post_url":"/t/rev-robotics-follower-issue/483795/1","custom_user_title":"5561 Prog Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3493709,"name":"Jake Gads","username":"gadzygadz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gadzygadz/{size}/200701_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T15:13:34.311Z","cooked":"

the following is untested but doesn’t throw errors
In 2025 REV moved a bunch of stuff to assign a follower it’s now

SparkMax follower;
SparkMaxConfig config = new SparkMaxConfig();
config.follow(leaderCANID); // there may be the SparkMax override for this can't check at work
follower.configure(config, ResetMode.kResetSafeParameters, PersistMode.kNoPersistParameters);

you can see examples of this in REV’s new example repo

github.com

REVrobotics/REVLib-Examples/blob/814041d57204e66ca93cdf15a5c77b44e0123bd1/Java/SPARK/Open Loop Arcade Drive/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java#L55


      
    
          
  1. globalConfig
    2. 
          
  2.     .smartCurrentLimit(50)
    3. 
          
  3.     .idleMode(IdleMode.kBrake);
    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5. // Apply the global config and invert since it is on the opposite side
    6. 
          
  6. rightLeaderConfig
    7. 
          
  7.     .apply(globalConfig)
    8. 
          
  8.     .inverted(true);
    9. 
          
  9. 
          
  10. // Apply the global config and set the leader SPARK for follower mode
    11. 
          
  11. leftFollowerConfig
    12. 
          
  12.     .apply(globalConfig)
    13. 
          
  13.     .follow(leftLeader);
    14. 
          
  14. 
          
  15. // Apply the global config and set the leader SPARK for follower mode
    16. 
          
  16. rightFollowerConfig
    17. 
          
  17.     .apply(globalConfig)
    18. 
          
  18.     .follow(rightLeader);
    19. 
          
  19. 
          
  20. /*
    21. 
          
  21.  * Apply the configuration to the SPARKs.
    22.
